quest.name: That Velveteen Dress
journal: Redolent Rose has need of your assistance yet again.

A sudden deluge of orders has the Weavers' Guild working at full stretch, and Redolent Rose cannot spare the time to attend a consultation with one of his clients. Go in the guildmaster's stead to the Gold Court and speak with Babawai and his daughter Kokomo.
Your meeting does not prove as enlightening as you had hoped due to the complete disinterest of your young client. Return to the Weavers' Guild and tell Redolent Rose what you have learned.

After a moment's consideration, Redolent Rose decides to craft a velveteen dress. Conscious of Babawai's reputation for exacting standards, he concludes that only the finest fabric will suffice. Weave a bolt of high-quality velveteen and deliver it to the guildmaster.

The guildmaster praises your velveteen, and assures you that it will make a most magnificent dress─albeit one which he suspects Kokomo has no intention of wearing.

※The next weaver quest will be available from Redolent Rose upon reaching level 30.
objectives: Deliver a bolt of undyed velveteen to Redolent Rose.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: This is indeed an unfortunate development...

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: Oh, Forename! Thank Nymeia you're here. I need your help.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: The entire guild is presently engaged in dealing with a sudden deluge of orders. Amongst them was a commission for a bespoke dress, all aspects of which I had intended to handle personally. Alas, I have just this moment received yet another request─this time from Her Grace─which must, naturally, take precedence.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: Since you have some experience engaging with customers, I would send you to speak with the client, Babawai, in my stead. We had arranged to meet at the Gold Court later this─ Ah, where has the time gone? Ahem. We had arranged to meet now.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: Babawai will be bringing his daughter Kokomo, for whom the dress is intended. Be sure to speak to her as well.

dialogue.name: KOKOMO
dialogue.text: You're from the Weavers' Guild? I'm terribly sorry you had to come all this way.

dialogue.name: KOKOMO
dialogue.text: Truth to tell, I don't really want another dress. But Father insisted, and when Father insists... <sigh> I just want this over and done with, so please, ask my father what he prefers, and I shall defer to his wishes.

dialogue.name: BABAWAI
dialogue.text: And who might you be? I was under the impression I would be meeting with the guildmaster. Well, it is of little matter, I suppose─provided the famous Redolent Rose still intends to design my daughter's dress.

dialogue.name: BABAWAI
dialogue.text: As for what manner of dress... Simply put, I'll not have my Kokomo garbed in common cotton. A jeweler's daughter must be refined─resplendent. A ruby amongst the riffraff.

dialogue.name: BABAWAI
dialogue.text: Her mere presence should reassure my customers as to the quality of my─ Ahem. I believe I have made myself clear. Pray relay my requirements to your guildmaster.

dialogue.name: WAWARUKKA
dialogue.text: <sigh>

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text:
Ah, you're back. So then, what manner of dress does our client desire?
...Something “resplendent,” which isn't made of cotton, you say? <sigh> I might have known. His commissions rarely stipulate anything beyond “ostentatiously expensive.”

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: And all for a poor girl who would rather the eyes of the world look the other way.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: Well, vanya silk would achieve the desired effect, though I doubt she would feel comfortable wearing such an extravagant dress. Velveteen, though...yes, velveteen might work.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: A fine weave of cotton yarn and diremite silk with a short, soft pile─beautiful yet subdued, like our modest maiden.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: It will be painstaking to prepare, but so be it.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: I shall see to the patterns. The velveteen, I leave in your capable hands.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: Know, though, that Babawai will not be satisfied with any ordinary fabric.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: Only the very best will suffice. In short, I require a bolt of the finest velveteen you can weave.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: Oh, have you woven the velveteen already?

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: ...It's been far too long since I last worked with quality velveteen.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: You've truly outdone yourself, Forename.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: Babawai's daughter shall have a most magnificent dress.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: A pity she is no more like to wear it than her father...

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: Though nothing would please me more than to be proven wrong.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: But I rather suspect another dress is the last thing that girl needs.

dialogue.name: KOKOMO
dialogue.text: Father knows best. And the guildmaster always produces such wonderful designs. No doubt I will be delighted as always.

dialogue.name: BABAWAI
dialogue.text: Kokomo is my treasure. I would have the world see her for the shining jewel that she is.
